Description: Shallow, barely crescentic axe-head: with three rear tangs, each with a single perforation. The ends of the lateral tangs are inclined and slightly curved. The blade has a sharp mid-rib running along its width, and the cutting edge is almost straight. The piece is slightly warped and quite thickly corroded. The line of the original haft is just visible on the central tang. The cutting edge is damaged.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 101, C-IV/4, pl. VII, 3.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (96)
